column4: is there a way in Gnome to put the system in standby or suspend to safely un-dock the laptop from a base station? Last time I tried doing it worked with the machine wide awake but then one time I corrupted the fs and had to reinstall.
did you check to see if your hardware supports standby?
no...I assume being able to go into standby in Windows has nothing to do with this?  Would it be in the Log Out menu if it was supported?
If you Log Out, it should give you some options, one of those being Suspend if your hardware supports it.
ok, so i guess mine doesn't support it then...
I guess that Dell Supsend Fix article should help me...lol
Read a bit more into it tho, I tried the same thing on my Dell 5150 and it cause my memory to bug out every 10 minutes
there is a link on that page that gives you details on your specific make of laptop
no actually that article is about closing the lid...that works finee on mine...but I will definitely look into those links..thx
do you know how to work with bash commands?
cause I ended up editing grub/menu.lst in bash tog et my laptop back to normal
I just dont want to leave you hanging
Looks like to suspend, you just have to close the monitor, then you can safely undock from the base.
